poem:
**Tropical Storm Ernesto**

A name given to winds
assembling in the Atlantic,
near-record warm, they say,
like the breath of old gods.

Ernesto is coming,
a visitor to the islands,
becoming the evening's story,
a wild dance
in the living air.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Caribbean islands added to tropical storm watch as new formation grows in Atlantic Several Caribbean islands were added to a tropical storm watch on Monday as a new major disturbance was brewing in an already turbulent Atlantic hurricane season. Expected to be named Tropical Storm Ernesto later in the day, the most recent addition to what is predicted to be an “above normal” tropical storm season – fueled by “near-record warm ocean temperatures in Atlantic”,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
